page.title: 15Religion, Faceby
page.content: Faceby is part of the{United Benefice} of Carlton, Faceby, Swainby and Potto in Stokesley Deanery and York Diocese, served by a vicar resident in Swainby, a non-stipendiary minister and three lay readers. On average 10-15 people attend morning worship at St Mary Magdalene Church, fewer at evensong. Alternative Services Book Series 2 is used and services are at 8 am, 11 am or 6 pm, one each Sunday. Faceby {Methodist}Chapel, built in 1866 and only a few yards from the church, closed in 1963 and Methodists attend Carlton Chapel. There is one{Jewish} and one{Roman Catholic}family. Although few people attend church regularly, the whole village supports fund-raising efforts for the upkeep of church and church hall, a building converted from vicarage outhouses, and the only public hall in Faceby.
